abstract.p: Coalition of New Jersey state lawmakers introduces resolution to boycott all official state travel to South Carolina until legislators there agree to remove Confederate Flag from roof it its statehouse (S)

block.p: A coalition of state lawmakers last week introduced a resolution to boycott all official state travel to South Carolina until legislators there agree to remove the Confederate Flag from the roof of its statehouse. The resolution would prohibit elected officials from attending conferences in South Carolina because the flag ''symbolizes hatred and bigotry,'' said Assemblyman LeRoy J. Jones, Jr., a Democrat from East Orange, who sponsored the resolution in the Assembly. Governor Whitman said she opposed the resolution because New Jersey lawmakers rarely travel to South Carolina for conferences.
